title: Top 10 Resume Mistakes to Avoid in 2025
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: Crafting a compelling resume is your ticket to landing interviews. In 2025, common mistakes include generic objectives, outdated email addresses, and walls of text. Always tailor your resume to each job description, include metrics when showcasing achievements, and keep the design clean and ATS-friendly.

title: Must-Have Skills for Getting Hired as a Fresher
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: Freshers often worry about lack of experience. But employers care more about your adaptability, communication skills, and willingness to learn. Technical skills like basic coding, MS Excel, and problem solving are in high demand. Highlight internship projects and be confident in interviews.

title: Remote Jobs in 2025: How to Find and Apply
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: Remote work has evolved post-pandemic. Platforms like LinkedIn, Remote.co, and We Work Remotely list thousands of remote opportunities. Tailor your resume for remote skills like async communication, time management, and self-discipline. Use tools like Zoom, Slack, and Trello to showcase remote readiness.

title: How to Ace a Technical Interview
author: Job Dhundho Experts
content: Cracking technical interviews requires a strong grasp of fundamentals. Practice data structures, algorithms, and system design. Use platforms like LeetCode, GeeksforGeeks, and InterviewBit. Don't just memorize answers — focus on explaining your thought process clearly.

title: Pow.bio says biomanufacturing is broken and its continuous fermentation tech will fix it
author: Christine Hall
content: Pow.bio intends to bring down the costs associated with biomanufacturing by reimagining of fermentation facility operations.

title: Best Free Courses to Learn In-Demand Skills
author: Job Dhundho Team
content: You don't need to spend money to upskill. Websites like Coursera, edX, and freeCodeCamp offer high-quality, free courses. Focus on skills like Excel, Data Analysis, JavaScript, React, or Java — all in demand in 2025. Consistency and project building is key to job-readiness.

title: LinkedIn Optimization Tips to Get More Job Offers
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: LinkedIn is your digital resume. Make sure your headline clearly states your role and value. Write a summary that's human, not robotic. Use keywords relevant to your industry and get endorsements for your skills. Recruiters are actively searching there — make your profile work for you.

title: How to Write a Cover Letter That Actually Works
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: A strong cover letter isn't a copy of your resume. It's a personalized note to the employer, showing your interest and alignment with the job. Use the company's name, explain how your skills meet their goals, and keep it concise but impactful.

title: You can now add PayPal and Venmo credit or debit cards to your Apple Wallet
author: Sarah Perez
content: PayPal announced today that users can now add their PayPal and Venmo credit or debit cards to their Apple Wallet. With this new integration, you can now make payments in-store, online or on apps using Apple Pay. The company notes that users will continue earning their cashback and rewards.

title: What Recruiters Look for in Freshers' LinkedIn Profiles
author: Job Dhundho Experts
content: Even if you have no work experience, recruiters want to see your passion, skills, and projects on LinkedIn. Use a clear profile photo, write a friendly summary, list academic achievements, and add featured projects and certifications.

title: How to Handle 'Tell Me About Yourself' in Interviews
author: Disha Aggarwal
content: This question sets the tone of your interview. Start with your current background, move to education, then highlight key projects or internships. End with why you’re excited for this role. Practice until it feels confident but not robotic.

author: Disha Aggarwal
